Gagal Masuk Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo Saat Sidak, Ini Kata Menpora
03 Nov 2019, 12:55 by Antara, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga (Menpora) RI, Zainuddin Amali, tidak bisa memasuki Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo Surabaya saat inspeksi mendadak (sidak) karena pintu stadion ini terkunci.
"Iya, saya datang ke sini untuk melihat langsung stadion. Apalagi GBT salah satu calon venue Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021," ujar Zainuddin Amali kepada wartawan di halaman depan stadion, Minggu sore, 3 November 2019.
Menpora yang datang menggunakan kendaraan RI-49 disambut Kepala Dinas Pemuda dan Olahraga Jatim, Soepratomo, dan Ketua KONI Jatim, Erlangga Satriagung, di lobi luar depan stadion.
Setelah diinformasikan stadion dalam keadaan terkunci, Menpora memilih mendekati kerumunan wartawan dan melihat lobi dalam stadion dari balik pintu kaca.
Tidak sampai 15 menit, Menpora meninggalkan lokasi untuk selanjutnya menuju Gedung Negara Grahadi di Jalan Gubernur Suryo Surabaya.
"Saya ke Grahadi setelah ini, ada pertemuan dengan Gubernur Jatim Khofifah Indar Parawansa beserta insan olahraga Jatim," kata Menpora.
Disinggung koordinasi dengan Pemerintah Kota Surabaya selaku pengelola stadion, Menpora mengatakan Kadispora Jatim, Soepratomo, sudah mencoba menghubungi Kadispora Surabaya, Afghani Wardhana, tapi gagal.
"Sudah Pak Kadispora Jatim mencoba menghubungi Pak Kadispora Surabaya tapi tidak dijawab. Padahal kami datang untuk melihat, lalu kalau ada yang perlu dibantu bisa kami bantu. Tapi ini tertutup begini ya bagaimana, mau bantu apa?" kata Menpora. Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo menjadi satu dari 10 stadion yang menjadi calon stadion Piala Dunia U-20 dua tahun mendatang.
text:
Failed to enter Bung Tomo Gelora Stadium when Sidak, This said the Minister of Youth and Sports
03 Nov 2019, 12:55 by Antara, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Minister of Youth and Sports (Menpora), Zainuddin Amali, cannot enter the Bung Tomo Surabaya Stadium during a sudden inspection (sudden inspection) because the stadium door is locked.
"Yes, I came here to see the stadium firsthand. Moreover, GBT is one of the candidates for the U-20 World Cup venue in 2021," Zainuddin Amali told reporters on the front page of the stadium, Sunday afternoon, 3 November 2019.
The Menpora who came using RI-49 vehicles was welcomed by the Head of the East Java Youth and Sports Office, Soepratomo, and the Chairman of the East Java KONI, Erlangga Satriagung, in the lobby outside the front of the stadium.
After being informed that the stadium was locked, the Menpora chose to approach the crowd of reporters and look at the stadium lobby from behind a glass door.
In less than 15 minutes, the Menpora left the location to then proceed to the Grahadi State Building on Jalan Suryo Governor Surabaya.
"I went to Grahadi after this, there was a meeting with East Java Governor Khofifah Indar Parawansa along with East Java sports people," said the Menpora.
Regarding coordination with the Surabaya City Government as the stadium manager, the Menpora said the East Java Kadispora, Soepratomo, had tried to contact the Surabaya Kadispora, Afghani Wardhana, but failed.
"Already Mr. East Java Kadispora tried to contact Mr. Kadispora Surabaya but it was not answered. Though we came to see, then if there is anything that needs help we can help. But this is closed like this, what should we do?" said the Menpora. Gelora Bung Tomo Stadium is one of 10 stadiums that are candidates for the U-20 World Cup stadium in the next two years.
